title: US judge rules against American Airlines, JetBlue partnership
description: Judge Leo Sorokin called the alliance a threat to 'full-throated competition' in the US airline industry.

title: US police officer charged for allegedly aiding Proud Boys
description: The leader of a Washington, DC police intelligence unit faces allegations that he tipped off leader of far-right group.

title: ‘Conundrum’: How the US is dealing with Assad normalisation
description: As the Arab world normalises relations with Syria, US pushes for concessions from the Assad government, analysts say.

title: Syrians protest al-Assad’s participation in Arab League summit
description: Hundreds gathered in northern Syria's Idlib and surrounding towns to decry Syrian regime's participation in Arab League.

title: FBI misused database for Jan 6 suspects, racial justice protests
description: Redacted report from an oversight court says the agency regularly accessed a database meant for foreign investigations.

title: Pentagon leaker Teixeira ordered to remain in jail before trial
description: Prosecutors had previously cited Teixeira's weapons and violent comments in arguing he should stay behind bars.

title: US Fed chair says unclear if interest rates need to rise more
description: The Fed chief reiterated that the central bank would now make decisions 'meeting by meeting'.

title: NASA announces that Bezos’s Blue Origin will build moon lander
description: The contract is a milestone for Bezos's space company after it lost a previous lunar-landing bid to competitor SpaceX.

title: What’s been the true impact of the so-called ‘war on terror’?
description: A leading US university report says more than 4.5 million people have died as a result.

title: US probes whether attack killed civilian, not al-Qaeda leader
description: A US air raid in Syria may have killed a poor farmer with 10 children rather than al-Qaeda leader as initially stated.

title: Republican says US debt-ceiling talks paused
description: Lead Republican negotiator on deb cap negotiations said talks have paused but White House said deal still possible.

title: G7 tightens sanctions over Russia’s war on Ukraine
description: On first day of G7 summit in Japan, US and partners announce new penalties aimed at punishing Russia.

title: Official Cyclone Mocha death toll in Myanmar rises to 145
description: Official death toll surges as the UN says at least 800,000 people in need of emergency food aid and other assistance.

title: The Greek economy is changing – but not fast enough
description: Greece is trying to encourage entrepreneurs to invest. But days before polls, businesses say state stands in the way.

title: Republicans push surge of laws targeting transgender people in US
description: Laws restricting transgender rights have piled up in recent months, underscoring likely 2024 election battle lines.

title: More than 100 people dead in communal clashes in central Nigeria
description: Intercommunal conflict has killed hundreds in recent years in the ethnically and religiously diverse Middle Belt region.

title: Businessman Kocner acquitted over journalist’s murder in Slovakia
description: A judge finds Marian Kocner not guilty of murdering Jan Kuciak and his fiancée in 2018.

title: China to boycott G20 meeting hosted by India in Kashmir
description: China, Pakistan condemn India for holding the event in the disputed territory.

title: No escape, no aid as fighting intensifies in Sudan’s West Darfur
description: While attention has focused on the conflict in Khartoum, an uptick in violence in el-Geneina is terrifying residents.

title: World Bank gives Mozambique $150m for Cyclone Freddy recovery
description: Part grant, part loan, the money is drawn from the bank's existing projects for Mozambique.

title: In photos: Kisses, handshakes for Syria’s al-Assad at Arab League
description: On Friday, the Syrian president attended the regional bloc’s 32nd summit that kicked off in Saudi Arabia.

title: Italy’s ex-PM Berlusconi discharged from hospital after six weeks
description: The leader of Forza Italia returns home after 45 days of treatment for a lung infection linked to chronic leukaemia.

title: Assad gets warm welcome as Syria welcomed back into Arab League
description: Syrian president attends first regional bloc summit since suspension over crackdown on anti-government protests in 2011.

title: More than 1 million people displaced by Sudan crisis, UN says
description: About 843,000 displaced internally and 250,000 have fled across Sudan's borders since fighting broke out a month ago.

title: Calls for clarity on how Mexico will address new US border rules
description: Advocates ask how Mexico will handle expulsions, increased stresses on asylum system after end of Title 42.

title: Social media lights up over pro-Erdogan quake-zone voters
description: A majority of cities affected by February's quakes voted for the ruling AK Party, igniting a wave of criticism online.

title: Iran executes three men linked to anti-government protests
description: The men were accused of killing a police officer and two members of a paramilitary group during last year's protests.

title: Pakistani city tense as police say will search Imran Khan’s house
description: Lahore operation could trigger more violence in nuclear-armed country grappling with political and economic instability.

title: Japan PM Kishida wants to abolish nuclear arms but build military
description: Kishida may become the leader most singularly responsible for cementing Japan’s turn away from decades of pacifism.

title: China’s Xi presents development plans for Central Asia
description: Xi Jinping meets leaders of five Central Asian nations at a summit in China, calls for trade and energy development.

title: How the creation of Israel ruined my life | Close Up
description: This Palestinian man still dreams of returning home, 75 years after his people were expelled from their land.

title: ‘Who isn’t condemning?’: Imran Khan on attacks on Pakistan army
description: The ex-PM's muted criticism of vandalism at military installations comes after more than a dozen leaders quit his party.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy makes surprise visit to Saudi Arabia
description: President says he is in the kingdom, where Arab leaders are hosting a regional summit.

title: Hundreds of people evacuated as wildfire rages in western Spain
description: Up to 1,500 hectares burn in the Extremadura region with windy weather complicating efforts to bring it under control.

title: Lebanon gets Interpol notice for central bank boss Riad Salameh
description: Interior Minister Bassam Mawlawi says he will arrest Salameh if the judiciary instructs him to do so.

title: ‘Struggle continues’: Salman Rushdie discusses knife attack
description: Award-winning novelist speaks at a New York gala in his first public appearance since he was attacked onstage last year.

title: Four people killed in eastern DRC ambush near gorilla park
description: Militia attacks have been frequent in parts of the eastern DRC, where multiple rebel groups have been based for decades.

title: Australian grandmother, 95, with dementia Tasered by police
description: Clare Nowland in critical condition after police used a Taser when she approached with a knife and her walker.

title: In Cape Verde, birthplace of morna, ideas and music collide
description: Praia's annual music expo provides an opportunity for West African music industry stakeholders to explore new frontiers.

title: The US needs to be coherent in its response to statelessness
description: The Biden administration should be fighting against this grave human rights violation both at home and abroad.

title: Brittney Griner’s WNBA return puts player salaries back in focus
description: As new season tips off, US women's basketball league faces questions over why its top stars must go abroad for more pay.

title: Analysis: How important is Syria’s return to the Arab League?
description: Many Arab states have accepted that Bashar al-Assad's government has survived in Syria, and want to return to normality.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy to attend G7 in Hiroshima to pressure Russia
description: Presence of Ukrainian president is likely to bolster G7 and NATO resolve to continue supplying weapons.

title: Putin targets Ukrainian civilians because he could in Syria
description: The Syrianisation of the Ukraine war is no coincidence. Russia got away with it once — and believes it will again.

title: History Illustrated: Malcolm X — Brutalised in America
description: Subjected to all kinds of racism, the gifted, plain-spoken orator became an inspiring role model for social justice.

title: HRW condemns Bangladesh, Myanmar on plan to repatriate Rohingya
description: HRW says Bangladesh 'shouldn't forget why Rohingya became refugees' and recognise that those factors have not changed.

title: Official death toll in Myanmar cyclone rises to at least 54
description: India is sending more aid to Yangon, but communications remain difficult, hampering the disaster response.

title: At least 13 killed, towns cut off in Italian floods
description: Rescue teams working to reach towns and villages in northern Italy inundated by flooding.

title: Hiroshima survivors warn G7 leaders about using nuclear bombs
description: As G7 summit kicks off, survivors of the 1945 atomic bomb caution world leaders about the human cost of nuclear weapons.

title: Half of world’s largest lakes, reservoirs losing water: Study
description: New study finds unsustainable human use has led to more than half of the largest lakes drying up around the world.

title: Tsunami warning as magnitude 7.7 quake hits near New Caledonia
description: Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said waves of up to 3 metres (10 feet) were possible for Vanuatu.

title: Scientists call on G7 to improve preparedness for next pandemic
description: Appeal comes amid concern strict intellectual property rules hamper the production of affordable vaccines and medicines.

title: Bakhmut battle rages as Ukraine claims advances, Russian retreat
description: The Institute for the Study of War says Ukrainian forces have seized the 'tactical initiative' in Bakhmut.

title: G7 Summit: Who are the climate walkers and the climate talkers?
description: Host Japan and the US are both betraying their climate commitments. Unless the G7 does better, the world won't.

title: Australian doctor freed 7 years after abduction in West Africa
description: Dr. Kenneth Elliott was taken captive in Burkina Faso in 2016 along with his wife who was released shortly after.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 450
description: As the war enters its 450th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: US Defence Dept error said to overvalue Ukraine arms aid by $3bn
description: Pentagon's accounting error could mean more funds are available for Ukraine military aid as counteroffensive nears.

title: Why Japan’s sleepy city of Hiroshima was chosen to host the G7
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida wants to “send a strong message” for a world without nuclear weapons.
